title: MS Engineer-L1
description: <strong>Looking for the next step in your career? Enjoy a challenge? Do you have an ambition for innovation? Want to make a difference? <br><br></strong>If you join our growing global team, you’ll be working for an industry leader with offices across five continents, in over 47 countries and more than 28 000 employees. You will work with some of the leading world brands across the Fortune 100 and Fortune 500 companies – who are all relying on Dimension Data to help them use the power of technology to achieve their ambition in this digital era.You’ll be part of a team who’s passionate about making a difference to the way technology shapes how we live and work – whether it’s protecting the rhino, connecting the G20 Summit, or revolutionising cycling, giving you the opportunity to do great things.<br><br>You’ll be joining a Global Top Employer, recognised for investing in talent because people are at the heart of our success. You provide the skills, passion and ideas, and we’ll provide the platform to realise your ambitions.Great talent. Great teams. Great work. Great opportunities.<br><br><strong>Want to be part of our team?<br><br></strong>Provides technical support to field engineers, technicians, and product support personnel who are diagnosing, troubleshooting, repairing, and debugging complex electro/mechanical equipment, computer systems, complex software, or networked and/or wireless systems.<br><br>Responds to situations where first-line product support has failed to isolate or fix problems in malfunctioning equipment or software. Reports design, reliability, and maintenance problems or bugs to design engineering/software engineering. May be involved in customer installation and training.<br><br>Provides support to customers/users where the product is highly technical or sophisticated in nature.<br><br><strong>What You'll Be Doing<br><br></strong>The MS Engineer is responsible for providing a service to clients by proactively identifying and resolving technical incidents and problems. Through preemptive service incident and resolution activities, as well as product reviews, operational improvements, operational practices, and quality assurance this role will maintain a high level of service to clients. Their primary objective is to ensure zero missed service level agreement (SLA) conditions .The MS Engineer s responsible for managing tickets of low to high complexity.<br><br><strong>Key Roles and Responsibilities:<br></strong><ul><li>Ensure that assigned infrastructure at the client site is configured, installed, tested, and operational</li><li>Perform necessary checks, apply monitoring tools and respond to alerts</li><li>Identify problems and errors prior to or when it occurs and log all such incidents in a timely manner with the required level of detail</li><li>Assist in analyzing, assigning, and escalating support calls</li><li>Investigate third line support calls assigned and identify the root cause of incidents and problems</li><li>Report and escalate issues to 3rd party vendors if necessary</li><li>Provide onsite technical support to clients and provide field engineering services to clients</li><li>Conduct a monthly random review of incidents and service requests, analyze and recommend improvement in quality</li><li>Provide continuous feedback to clients and affected parties and update all systems and/or portals as prescribed by NTT</li><li>Proactively identify opportunities for work optimization including opportunities for automation of work<br><br></li></ul><strong>Knowledge, Skills, and Attributes:<br></strong><ul><li>Ability to communicate and work across different cultures and social groups</li><li>Ability to plan activities and projects well in advance, and takes into account possible changing circumstances</li><li>Ability to maintain a positive outlook at work</li><li>Ability to work well in a pressurized environment</li><li>Ability to work hard and put in longer hours when it is necessary</li><li>Ability to apply active listening techniques such as paraphrasing the message to confirm understanding, probing for further relevant information, and refraining from interrupting</li><li>Ability to adapt to changing circumstances</li><li>Ability to place clients at the forefront of all interactions, understanding their requirements, and creating a positive client experience throughout the total client journey<br><br></li></ul><strong>Academic Qualifications<br></strong><ul><li>Advanced diploma, degree, or relevant qualification in IT/Computing (or demonstrated equivalent work experience)<br><br></li></ul><strong>Required Experience:<br></strong><ul><li>Demonstrated work experience</li><li>Demonstrated experience required in Engineering function within a medium to large ICT organization</li><li>Demonstrated experience of Managed Services</li><li>Demonstrated working knowledge of ITIL processes</li><li>Demonstrated experience working with vendors and/or 3rd parties<br><br></li></ul><strong>What would make you a good fit for this role?<br><br></strong><strong>Join our growing global team and accelerate your career with us. Apply today.<br><br></strong><strong>Equal opportunity employer <br><br></strong>We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer with a global culture that embraces diversity. We are committed to providing an environment free of unfair discrimination and harassment. We do not discriminate based on age, race, colour, sex, religion, national origin, disability, pregnancy, marital status, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, veteran status, or other protected category.

title: Cloud Software Compliance Engineer
description: We are looking for a motivated individual to serve as a Cloud Software Compliance Engineer to ensure the top-quality launch of SaaS products across the organization. Long seen as a leader in radically simple IT hardware, Ubiquiti is building additional cloud-based SaaS offerings to better serve our customers. You will play a pivotal role in this expansion<p><br></p>You should be interested in operating a high-growth technology business, contributing to our company’s mission of <strong>rethinking IT</strong>.<p><br></p><strong><u>About The Role And Team</u></strong><p><br></p>As the Cloud Software Compliance Engineer you will be responsible for designing, implementing, and maintaining a comprehensive security program that ensures the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of an organization's information and systems. This includes developing and enforcing security policies and procedures, performing risk assessments and security audits, and ensuring compliance with relevant laws and regulations.<p><br></p>This is role fits into a major strategic priority for the company with high executive leadership visibility.<p><br></p><strong><u>As Cloud Software Compliance, You Will</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Drive security compliance for our cloud SaaS offerings, improve the risk management function, and build trust with stakeholders to improve control maturity &amp; accountability </li><li> Work directly with Engineering teams to design efficient, performant controls in a cloud-first environment that meet our compliance needs (e.g., SOC, ISO, GDPR) </li><li> Implement tools to ensure that reliably track our long-term compliance and scale with the software and the organization </li><li> Define security risk &amp; compliance program objectives, identify key metrics, cultivate relationships with stakeholders, and report quantifiable progress to executive leadership. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Desired Qualifications</u></strong><ul><li> A Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or an equivalent combination of education and experience. </li><li> 3+ years of engineering experience progressively responsible work experience in IT/Security governance, risk, and compliance, security assurance, or third-party risk and customer trust </li><li> Experience operating as part of a information security program, reporting into an Engineering organization, or building the second line of defense at a growth company </li><li> Technical understanding of best practices for implementing cloud-native controls for SOC2, ISO, and GDPR compliance in a fast-paced environment </li><li> Willingness to work with international engineering teams, including sometimes outside of normal American working hours</li><ul><li> Note: We work flexibly as a company, and will work to make the working time requirements as manageable as possible </li></ul><li> Willingness to work in a fast-paced startup-like environment with exposure to the entire executive team </li><li> Chinese language experience is a plus, but not required </li></ul><p><br></p><strong> Location and Working Conditions </strong><ul><li> Hybrid office / remote model, with commuting distance to Downtown Chicago office required</li><ul><li> Will consider fully-remote (US/Canada) for exceptional candidates </li></ul><li> Report to the Product Lead for a cloud SaaS offering (based in Chicago) and significant exposure to entire executive team </li><li> Work closely with the Head of Cybersecurity, Engineering teams, and Legal team </li><li> Casual dress </li><li> Access to office snacks and refreshments </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Benefits</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Work with the latest advances in technology </li><li> Fully-paid, high-coverage medical insurance including dental and vision </li><li> 401(k) program with company match </li><li> Company products for home lab setups </li><li> Flexible working hours and terms</li></ul>

title: SW Test Automation Engineer - Mobile Testing
description: If you are a current Chamberlain Group employee, please click here to apply through your Workday account.<p><br></p>At Chamberlain Group (CG), we hire smart, creative people to work on next-gen products for a connected world. We are passionate technologists with bold ideas and diverse perspectives. Our Engineering teams—spanning mechanical, firmware, machine learning and AI, cloud, and mobile technologies and more—reinvent access by combining hardware with cutting-edge, cloud-based solutions to create a safer, smarter customer experience. At CG, we encourage flexibility, fun, and a healthy work/life balance, including remote options.<p><br></p>Chamberlain Group is a global leader in access solutions with top brands, such as LiftMaster and Chamberlain, found in millions of homes, businesses, and communities worldwide. As a leader in the Smart Home industry, we boast one of the largest IoT install bases, with innovative products consisting of cameras, locks, card readers, garage door openers, gates and more, all powered by our myQ digital ecosystem.<p><br></p>This is a role within CGI's Engineering group. A successful incumbent is expected to lead quality assurance through test case development, test script / automation development and test execution for new features and regression testing of one or more of the following depending on assignment: mobile apps, web sites, middleware, IOT devices (such as Garage Door Openers, Commercial Access Controls, Video enabled products)<p><br></p><strong>Job Responsibilities:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Lead quality assurance through test case development, test script / automation development and test execution for new features and regression testing of one or more of the following depending on assignment: mobile apps, web sites, middleware, IOT devices (such as Garage Door Openers, Commercial Access Controls, Video enabled products)</li><li>Work with QE &amp; Dev team to define process and strategy associated with test automation, and implement best practices for testing of firmware, web, middleware, and mobile apps</li><li>Participate in Scrum, Daily Stand-up, Sprint and iterative development activities. Collaborate with agile team members, scrum master, developers and product owners to support quality assurance activities</li><li>Analyze user stories for new features and tickets asiigned, develop test cases and automation, verify them, and support regression testing</li><li>Lead QE team in supporting quality assurance activities for assigned Scrum teams, projects</li><li>Responsible for test case and test script development / reviews, requirements traceability analysis.</li><li>Plan test schedules or strategies in accordance with project scope / delivery dates</li><li>Responsible for creation, execution, and maintenance of test plans</li><li>Manage complete scope of work assigned and coordinate with remote and external teams</li><li>Summarize test results. Provide accurate traceability and bug reports for Go/No-Go decisions</li><li>Responsible for complying with the security requirements set forth by the Information Security team and the established ISO 27001 Security Roles, Responsibilities, and Authorities Document found in the ISMS Document Library</li><li>Comply with health and safety guidelines and rules; managers should also ensure compliance across their teams</li><li>Protect CGI’s reputation by keeping information confidential</li><li>Maintain professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops, professional publications, establishing personal networks, and participating in professional societies</li><li>Contribute to the team effort by accomplishing related results and participating on projects as needed</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Job Requirements:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's Degree in Engineering, Computer Science or related field, or equivaleny pactical experience</li><li>An advanced degree in directly applicable area of study may substitute for up to two (2) years of experience</li><li>3+ years experience in automation testing development</li><li>2+ years’ experience with test automation of mobile applications is a must</li><li>2+ years experience in Automation tools like Selenium, Appium, SoapUI, RestAssured</li><li>Hands on experience with implementing Continuous Integration and build automation systems such as Jenkins/ Bamboo/ Octopus etc.</li><li>Experience with Source Code Management Tools (e.g. Git, TFS, RTC)</li><li>Experience in test case development, test plans and test reports</li><li>Experience with Test Management, Bug Tracking, Collaboration tools (e.g. Testrail, Jira, Confluence)</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Proficiency with one or more of the following programming languages/frameworks: C#, Java, Python, .NET/Java frameworks</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Job Requirements: </strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's Degree in Engineering, Computer Science or related field</li><li>Quality Assurance Certifications (e.g. ISTQB)</li><li>Coding Certifications</li><li>Cloud Certifications</li><li>2+ years experience with test automation of IOT devices and middleware.</li><li>1+ years experience in Automation testing of Cloud hosted applications, middleware</li><li>1+ years experience in agile testing</li><li>Hardware testing and automation experience</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Experience in TDD/BDD approaches and relevant tools such as cucumber</li><li>Experience in IOT domain</li></ul><p><br></p>We're an organization who values its human capital and provides support to assist its employees succeed.<p><br></p>Chamberlain Group is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. You will be considered for this position based upon your experience and education, without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, ancestry; marital, disabled or veteran status. We are committed to creating and maintaining a workforce environment that is free from any form of discriminations or harassment.<p><br></p>Persons with disabilities who anticipate needing accommodations for any part of the application process may contact, in confidence Recruiting@Chamberlain.com.<p><br></p>NOTE: Staffing agencies, headhunters, recruiters, and/or placement agencies, please do not contact our hiring managers via email or phone or other methods.

description: <strong>About The Team<br><br></strong>The ESG Portfolio and Fund Methodologies team is a new area of expertise within the ESG Methodology &amp; Product Architecture Team at Morningstar Sustainalytics, having been previously based under Morningstar’s Managed Investment Data. The team is dedicated to developing and enhancing ESG methodologies for managed investment (fund) universes and custom client portfolios for both Sustainalytics and Morningstar products. They work across various peer groups within the broader ESG Methodology &amp; Product Architecture Team to determine how methodologies should be reflected at the portfolio level, such as the Morningstar Sustainability (“Globe”) Ratings, while also developing fund-specific methodologies, such as Sustainable Attributes. Team members cover a wide range of content, such as Climate, Impact, and ESG Risk, while also identifying opportunities for cohesiveness across different methodologies.<br><br><strong>About The Role<br><br></strong>This is an exciting opportunity to own methodology development and enhancement for ESG Portfolio and Fund data. You will be working across Sustainalytics and Morningstar methodology, commercial, and technical stakeholders to develop and present methodology concepts, translate these into detailed specifications for technical and data operations teams, as well as publish methodology documentation for our clients. The role is preferred to be based in Chicago, Toronto, or Amsterdam, but applicants in Frankfurt will also be considered. A long-term remote work arrangement will not be considered for this role.<br><br><strong>Key Responsibilities<br></strong><ul><li>Lead and collaborate new methodology development for portfolios and managed investments (funds) by leveraging a subject matter background of managed investment and portfolio data to translate issuer level methodology into the fund/portfolio level, as well as identifying and developing fund specific methodologies.</li><li>Presenting on methodology concepts to methodology managers and other stakeholders.</li><li>Translating a methodology concept into detailed methodology specification documents in Excel and/or Python for technical teams to understand and implement. This includes the scope and definition of data sets, methodology logic/requirements, data modelling, and examples of calculation logic or data collection processes.</li><li>Testing of internal and external validity of methodology including change/impact analyses.</li><li>Authorship of external facing methodology papers.</li><li>Supporting product managers as well as client support teams for escalations of methodology related questions, including interfacing with clients as a subject matter expert.<br><br></li></ul><strong>Qualifications<br></strong><ul><li>Minimum of a bachelor’s degree, with excellent academic credentials.</li><li>Minimum of three years of experience in financial services or investing.</li><li>Minimum of three years of research and/or product development experience.</li><li>Demonstrated ability to utilize data to draw insights and propose solutions.</li><li>Demonstrated ability to communicate and collaborate across global stakeholders.</li><li>A strong quantitative skillset, with a background in quantitative analysis, programming, statistics, econometrics, modelling, and/or big data processing considered an asset. Applicants should have a strong knowledge of MS Excel, and basic to intermediate knowledge of working with large data sets using Python, SQL/ AWS, or other basic programming skills as well as a willingness to grow that skill.<br><br></li></ul><strong>Nice to Have<br></strong><ul><li>Subject matter knowledge or experience with Morningstar managed investment/fund data operations and methodology is considered a strong asset.</li><li>Experience with ESG data is considered an asset, but not required. We believe the right candidate will be able to learn the subject matter and apply their experience to ESG concepts.</li><li>Experience utilizing LEAN, Six Sigma, or Agile methodologies in a project management or data operations setting is considered an asset.<br><br></li></ul><strong>About Us<br><br></strong>Sustainalytics is a Morningstar company dedicated to responsible investment with over 25 years' experience in ESG research and ratings. With an extensive client base across asset managers, asset owners and investment banks, our mission is to provide the insights required for investors and companies to make more informed decisions that lead to a more just and sustainable global economy.<br><br>As Morningstar’s ESG center of excellence we are responsible for driving both the commercial success and innovation of its ESG products as well as its overall ESG strategy.<br><br>For more information, visit www.sustainalytics.com<br><br>Morningstar’s hybrid work environment gives you the opportunity to work remotely and collaborate in-person each week. While some positions are available as fully remote, we’ve found that we’re at our best when we’re purposely together on a regular basis, typically three days each week. A range of other benefits are also available to enhance flexibility as needs change. No matter where you are, you’ll have tools and resources to engage meaningfully with your global colleagues.
